name: Grand Hotel Hermitage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here two nights as part of a package trip. The views are spectacular if you have a room with a view. we had to pay extra. they showed us the standard room and it was dark and depressing. It is a drive up the hill so if you want to be in Sorrento pick another place. But....I have never in my life slept (or tried to) on a harder bed. It felt like a table with a sheet on it. So this kind of ruined it for me.
reviews.title: the hardest bed I've ever slept on

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a wonderful week in the Grand Hermitage, the staff were so kind and attentive, the food amazing and the location was perfect for us. Only 10 minutes on the hotel shutlle bus from Sorrento, so a quiet tranquil haven away from the hustle and bustle of Sorrento. The little town of St Agata is a 6-8 min walk up the little pathway from the hotel and is pretty. I recommend getting a room with the stupendous sea view, with the bay of Naples and Vesuvious like a picture postcard - when we return to Sorrento we will definitely return to the Grand Hotel Hermitage
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel in a beautiful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: I went to Sorrento with my girlfriend to enjoy a romantic holiday away from busy London. Sorrento and Capri is a perfect location to relax and unwind. There is a coach from outside the airport for 10 euros which takes about 1 hour. When reaching the train station terminal DO NOT GET THE 40 Euro taxis to your hotel (the taxi drivers are the most expensivley dressed people in Sorrento!, there are busses that will take you for 1 euro, just give the driver your hotel name.
reviews.title: Enjoyable, relaxing hide away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the hotel the staff were very accomodating and always greeted us very warmly. We were lucky enough to stay in the Villa Romita which i would recommend over the hotel itself and a perfect location for couples as it is secluded with very nice views, very quite and has a nice little 5 minute walk to Sant Agata. The room was quite small and the single beds pushed together was annoying, but it was well tended and kept very clean. The pool was quite small and initially very cold, there were enough loungers for everyone. We did not eat at the hotel due to the number of local restauraunts. The hotel bus to and from town is very helpful but ask in the morning as it can get filled particularly in the evening, there are local busses from outside if required during the day.
reviews.title: Grand Hotel Hermitag was grand

description: Nestled in woodland consisting of ancient trees and flowers, and overlooking the splendid Gulf of Naples, this tranquil hotel effortlessly blends tradition with modern amenities and services. Although the hotel is detached from the noise and chaos of Sorrento, it is within 10 minutes walk of the charming village of Sant’Agata sui due Golfi, which can be accessed via the hotel’s private path. Sorrento can also be reached on the shuttle bus service, which runs from May to October and stops in front of the hotel. Fitness point with a lovely Jacuzzi pool, and any massage treatment are available to enjoy and relax your holiday.Spend long days relaxing by the outdoor pool for adults and the smaller pool for children, or sipping drinks on the terrace overlooking the unique scenery of the Gulf. Discounts may apply for longer stays.Newly renovated, these rooms are furnished with a lovely terracotta tile floor and antique-style wood furniture, giving a sense of an ancient farmhouse villa. These rooms also have a wonderful view over the Gulf of Naples. All rooms are with individual air-conditioning and Wi-fi connection
